intro: Quapoya laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered quapoya, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
